title: Will the industrial farming system destroy the ecosystem? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. It already has to a very dangerous extent. But the Rodale Institute in the US is claiming sucess with field scale Organic No-Till techniques that look very good from their promotional material. I think it is fair to describe that system as “industrial farming” and although all farming alters ecosystems this approach seems relatively benign. This talk on how to fight desertification and reverse climate change http://go.ted.com/tZyc1w describes how an argyably intensive “industrialised approach” can actually engineer improved ecology. This is the reverse of conventional industry (grain fed) practices. There are other aporoaches like Masanobu Fukuoka’s Natural Farming but they operate on a much more human rather than industrial scale.
